snippet: When Indianapolis didn’t give residents who had prepaid their sewer bills a refund, the city ended up at the Supreme Court.
abstract: Editorial urges the Supreme Court to rule in favor of Indianapolis residents who prepaid in full a sewer tax, which was forgiven for those who opted to pay on an installment plan when the city changed its laws; argues that the city's decision to not refund the payments equally is a violation both the Constitution's equal protection guarantee and common sense.
lead_paragraph: When Indianapolis didn’t give residents who had prepaid their sewer bills a refund, the city ended up at the Supreme Court.
